definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Spring Festival period, each and every family must manufacture dozens of catty glutinous rice glutinous rice cakes.
sentences.chinese: 春节期间，家家户户都要制作数十斤的糯米糍粑。

sentences.english: Families fled for Iran or for the hills.
sentences.chinese: 家家户户逃往伊朗或者山区。

sentences.english: The houses in this village are without water.
sentences.chinese: 这个村子里家家户户都没有自来水。

sentences.english: We have to wait until the technology is available in every home.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须等到这种技术在家家户户都能实现了才行。

sentences.english: As the enemy advance continued, whole families would take to the bush.
sentences.chinese: 随着敌军逼近，家家户户都将逃入丛林。

sentences.english: Every family, Ann demons and ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 家家户户烧纸钱，安鬼平和鬼团圆。

sentences.english: The woodlands have hushed their songs, and doors are all shut at every house.
sentences.chinese: 林地里，歌声归于沉寂，家家户户都关门了。

sentences.english: Every family will pack the silkworm eggs in paper, and start to hatch them.
sentences.chinese: 家家户户将蚕种纸包好，开始孵蚕卵。

sentences.english: As evening falls, each family begins to put on their lights.
sentences.chinese: 初更时候，家家户户开始燃起灯火。

sentences.english: As for our village every family live in a building, I know not.
sentences.chinese: 至于我们村家家户户住楼房的事，我知道不现实。

sentences.english: Aviculture plant flowers in almost every household, life is full of fun.
sentences.chinese: 几乎家家户户都养花养鸟，生活充满情趣。

sentences.english: People in small Iowa towns locked their doors for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 在爱荷华的小镇上，家家户户第一次锁上了门。

sentences.english: Families hung wormwood and calamus on the door for the traditional Double-Fifth Festival in ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 旧时的端午节，家家户户都会在门口挂艾草，插菖蒲。

sentences.english: Thirty years ago, families gathered around a radio each evening.
sentences.chinese: 三十年前，家家户户每天晚上围坐着听收音机。

sentences.english: Today is the 5th day of the Chinese New Year. People eat dumplings on this day.
sentences.chinese: 今天是“破五”，按照习俗，家家户户都要吃饺子。

sentences.english: And the gala is now a special dish in the table already.
sentences.chinese: “春晚”已经成为家家户户餐桌上的一道特殊的菜肴。

definition: to kill the pigs and slaughter the sheep (idiom)
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
kill the chickens and butcher the geese (idiom)
at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
to shop in preparation for Chinese New Year
to offer sacrifices to the kitchen god
merchandise sold for Chinese New Year
men, women, young and old/all kinds of people/people of all ages
